org.spongepowered.api.world.extent

Interface Extent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BiomeArea, BlockVolume, EntityUniverse, Identifiable, LocationCompositeValueStore, MutableBiomeArea, MutableBlockVolume, TileEntityVolume
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Chunk, World

    public interface Extent
extends EntityUniverse, TileEntityVolume, MutableBiomeArea, LocationCompositeValueStore, Identifiable
    A mutable object containing blocks, tile entities, entities, and possibly other game objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        Location<? extends Extent> getLocation(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Gets a location in this extent at the given position. Essentially, this is a 3D pointer in the extent.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The location in this extent

      • getLocation

        Location<? extends Extent> getLocation(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int z)
        Gets a location in this extent at the given position. Essentially, this is a 3D pointer in the extent.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        The location in this extent

      • getLocation

        Location<? extends Extent> getLocation(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d position)
        Gets a location in this extent at the given position. Essentially, this is a 3D pointer in the extent. This method supports sub-block positions. Block-related methods use flooring to get integer coordinates.
        Parameters:
        position - The position
        Returns:
        The location in this extent

      • getLocation

        Location<? extends Extent> getLocation(double x,
                                       double y,
                                       double z)
        Gets a location in this extent at the given position. Essentially, this is a 3D pointer in the extent. This method supports sub-block positions. Block-related methods use flooring to get integer coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        The location in this extent

      • getBlockSnapshot

        BlockSnapshot getBlockSnapshot(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position)
        Get a snapshot of this block at the current point in time.

        A snapshot is disconnected from the Extent that it was taken from so changes to the original block do not affect the snapshot.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        Returns:
        A snapshot

      • getBlockSnapshot

        BlockSnapshot getBlockSnapshot(int x,
                               int y,
                               int z)
        Get a snapshot of this block at the current point in time.

        A snapshot is disconnected from the Extent that it was taken from so changes to the original block do not affect the snapshot.

        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        Returns:
        A snapshot

      • setBlockSnapshot

        void setBlockSnapshot(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i position,
                      BlockSnapshot snapshot)
        Replace the block at this position with a copy of the given snapshot.

        Changing the snapshot afterwards will not affect the block that has been placed at this location.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the block
        snapshot - The snapshot

      • setBlockSnapshot

                      int y,
                      int z,
                      BlockSnapshot snapshot)

        Changing the snapshot afterwards will not affect the block that has been placed at this location.

        Parameters:
        x - The X position
        y - The Y position
        z - The Z position
        snapshot - The snapshot

      • getExtentView

        Extent getExtentView(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMin,
                     com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i newMax)
        Returns a new extent that is the same or smaller than the current extent. This does not copy the data, it only provides a new view of the extent.
        Parameters:
        newMin - The new minimum coordinates in this extent
        newMax - The new maximum coordinates in this extent
        Returns:
        The new extent with the new bounds
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfBoundsException - If the new minimum and maximum are outside the current extent

      • getExtentView

        Extent getExtentView(DiscreteTransform3 transform)
        Returns a new extent that is viewed through some transformation. This does not copy the data, it only provides a new view of the extent.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transformation to be applied
        Returns:
        The new extent with the transform

      • getRelativeExtentView

        Extent getRelativeExtentView()
        Returns a new extent that is translated so that BlockVolume.getBlockMin() returns Vector3i.ZERO. This does not copy the data, it only provides a new view of the extent.
        Returns:
        The new extent its minimum at zero
